summary: An email chain from August 10, 2019, detailing the timeline of events leading to Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. It includes his placement on and removal from suicide watch, his cellmate status, and the discovery of his body.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive and later pronounced dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate (inmate number 85993-054) from July 29, 2019, until his release to the community on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Unit Manager
persons.context: Gave Epstein a telephone call on the evening of August 9, 2019, and reported he was in good spirits.

connections.description: Were cellmates in the Special Housing Unit from July 29, 2019, until Reyes's release on August 9, 2019.

events.title: Epstein Found in Fetal Position
events.description: Epstein was found in a fetal position in his cell, breathing but unresponsive initially. His neck was red. He was placed on suicide watch and received a medical evaluation.

events.title: Epstein Removed from Suicide Watch
events.description: The Psychology Services Department removed Epstein from suicide watch after daily interactions. He was returned to the Special Housing Unit with a cellmate.

events.title: Cellmate Released, Epstein Alone
events.description: Cellmate Reyes was released from court to the community and did not return. Epstein was in a legal visit all day and was returned to a cell with no cellmate, contrary to his required PSYCH Alert status.

events.title: Epstein Found Dead
events.description: Staff found Epstein unresponsive in his cell during breakfast service. CPR was initiated. He was pronounced dead at the hospital at 7:36 a.m. Bruising was reported around his neck and an orange makeshift noose was found in the cell.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: Epstein was removed from suicide watch on July 29, 2019, and placed with a cellmate, despite a prior incident on July 23 where he was found in a fetal position with a red neck.
On August 9, 2019, Epstein's cellmate was released, leaving Epstein alone in his cell overnight, which violated the protocol of his PSYCH Alert status requiring a cellmate.
Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell on the morning of August 10, 2019, and pronounced dead at the hospital. Staff reported bruising on his neck and an orange makeshift noose in the cell.
Two officers failed to conduct the 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. official counts on the night of Epstein's death; one officer did not respond when asked about 30-minute checks.

The email is a forwarded timeline intended to ensure the Department of Justice (DOJ) was aware of the events being relayed, indicating internal communication about the circumstances of Epstein's death.
